tweets.text:
BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

At the risk of upsetting the mainland @CastlePointBC Councillors, you have supported your Local Plan at the Expense of the Local Environment! Shame on You! https://t.co/54OHYm60xj via @wordpressdotcom @EnvAgency @AnglianWater

"Be in no doubt that anything less than a prosecution and full restoration of the river, paid for by the perpetrator, will be acceptable‚Äù.

@EnvAgency and others want to prove they are fit for the 21st century? Here's your chance. https://t.co/ji0wmcYyhf

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

The brilliant Julia Simpson from the Environment Agency briefed me today on local flood defences. I also raised illegal mooring of boats in Molesey. EA looking at what more can be done. https://t.co/74A4k7KKwa

@EmmaHowardBoyd @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @COP26 @DefraGovUK @WRIClimate @GCAdaptation @CASsummit2021 @AdaptOurWorld @GFI_green @cabinetofficeuk Perhaps you could ensure that the Thames Flood Relief channel from Windsor to Bell Weir goes ahead to avoid further flooding of Datchet, Old Windsor and Wraysbury

@FoeCambridge @lewis_herbert @greenarteries @Feargal_Sharkey @TerryMac999 @markrwilliamson @dottymcl @BBCCambs @CambsCC @wre @GreaterCambs @EnvAgency @DefraUK @cllrbridget @ab4scambs @OliviaRudgard @camcitco @cllrkatie @DanielZeichner @SouthCambs @mhclg @DefraGovUK Net zero carbon is one thing, but (conveniently?) ignores #water.

We are in a #ClimateEmergency, but also a #NatureEmergency.

Water is the basis of life. Without it our ecosystems collapse.

We need Net Zero Water too. https://t.co/jGkUPXGes5

tweets.text: We need more investment in climate adaptation. The UK is a founding member of the Coalition for Climate Resilient Investment, which is made up of organisations with more than $10 trillion in assets under management, helping to build resilience around the world. #AdaptOurWorld https://t.co/Ko9UlUQoFP

The Favourite River Lugg https://t.co/8wSOjau4U5

@herefordtimes @HerefordshireWT @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @HerefordRaces @MilesKing10 @FarmersWeekly @NFUtweets @HelenStace_HWT @WildlifeTrusts @WildTroutTrust @PondRiverStream @Buzz_dont_tweet @MattEAShardlow https://t.co/LRMJfWnros

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

We‚Äôre building resilience to the effects of #ClimateChange at home through our Flood and Coastal Erosion Risk Management Strategy, and accompanying funding of ¬£5.2bn for new flood and coastal defences. #AdaptOurWorld #TogetherForNature https://t.co/iQoWyQRhuZ

tweets.text: Our NFM measures (felled + pinned trees) are now living up to their name as leaky woody debris dams,  holding back water in high flows and creating new in-stream habitats in Dalby Forest.¬†Great to see new growth on the coppiced alders too. @Dalby_Forest @josh_NFM @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/rc0QUlEn0y
@JanetHughes I would love to see this in the @EnvAgency and @DefraGovUK for flooding. @KateMarksEA @frazer_HX @cathy_dutton @ehlehneh

We're excited to announce our Love Your River Cole project has been awarded a ¬£705,000 grant from the #GreenRecoveryChallengeFund. We're leading a partnership to help transform the Cole valley in the West Midlands.
@EnvAgencyMids #TogetherForOurPlanet @DefraGovUK, @HeritageFundUK https://t.co/dD1mXbEJf6

We've set up a blog so we can share more about our #futurefarming work.
 
Here's a post on what the blog is for and how you can sign up to get an email whenever we publish a new post: https://t.co/Iweit2KqCD

There's not very much else there yet. Watch this space...

Lessons in river hydrology - dredging a river increases flow exacerbating flood peaks to make flooding more likely. SLOW the flow. The landowner knows what is best for his/her farm business. The EA has to take a wider view. @HerefordshireWT @EnvAgency https://t.co/Vj6w0X4y8k
